data.title: Explore Hundreds of Careers in Art & Design
data.meta_description: Looking for a rewarding and fulfilling career in the art industry? Explore hundreds of art careers and discover your passion today.
data.text:
We’ve all heard the statistics about how hard it is to make it as an artist: only 17% of artists earn their living exclusively from selling art, there is high competition for art jobs, and the cost of art school can be prohibitive. But we don’t think those statistics accurately reflect the opportunities that exist today. The art industry is thriving and is a great place for dedicated, creative people to find meaningful work.

We’re here to help you navigate this sometimes difficult road from aspiring artist to successful professional. Not all artists are cut from the same mold and there are many different paths that can lead to rewarding careers depending on your personal interests, talents, and skills.

Art is an expansive field with many sub-categories, each with its own unique demands and opportunities. Some artists are better suited to traditional fine art methods while others thrive in digital or graphic arts; some find fulfillment primarily as teachers, educators, curators, writers, producers, etc. Still, others prefer careers primarily behind the scenes in administrative positions. Below is a list of some of the most popular careers in art.

The field of Craft and Fine Art attracts those who enjoy the process of creating tangible objects. From glassblowers to graphic designers, crafters and fine artists love working with their hands so they can discover and create beauty in everyday life. Craft and Fine Art is all about the creation of art. This can take many forms, like pottery, painting, sculpture, leatherworking, etc. There is a wide range of crafts and fine arts that fall under this career path, and there are numerous paths you can take to get into the field.

The culinary world is a diverse and expansive one with highly skilled professionals. Opportunities for culinary professionals are vast with a range of career paths from line cooks in a restaurant to chefs at the helm of their own kitchens. What makes for a successful culinary professional? A passion for cooking and creativity, an exceptional work ethic, and enjoyment of meeting challenges are just some of the qualities that make for success.

Digital artists use a wide range of computer software to create graphics, animation, and special effects for websites, videos, computer games, and other electronic media. They come from a variety of backgrounds in Art & Design fields such as illustration, graphic design, painting, photography, animation, video production, and music.

The demand for digital artists is growing exponentially as the world continues to become more technology-driven. Digital art is now being incorporated into web design, graphic design, motion graphics, product design, video games, and much more.

If you dream of a life in the theater, there are many career options available to help make that happen. From acting and directing to stagehands and set designers, there is a diverse range of jobs available to those dedicated to the arts. If you’re a performer at heart, there is an abundance of opportunities working on stage, television, movies, and even the internet. If you prefer to work behind the scenes or in front of a camera instead of on stage, there are also plenty of opportunities to do that, too.

The fashion industry is a vast, exciting place to work. It includes everything from the clothing that people wear, down to the stitching of each thread. And while most people know that it takes designers and models to make the world of fashion possible, there are many different types of careers in this field that require different backgrounds and skillsets.

Most people who work in fashion are involved in the actual designing of clothing, but there are many careers in this industry that have nothing to do with actual clothing design. Fashion industry professionals enjoy a variety of careers ranging from the creative (designers) to the business-related (store managers, buyers), to the technical (industrial engineers, pattern makers), to the hands-on artistic (dressmakers, tailors).

Accessories Designer

An accessories designer is a person who designs and manufactures accessories, such as belts, bags, shoes, and hats. These range from apparel to jewelry to bags as well as other fashion items like cosmetics, watches, and even footwear. The design field of fashion accessories includes a wide array of different options in the industry.

Costume Designer

A costume designer is a professional who works on the design of costumes for stage, film, television, video games, and other performance venues. Costume designers are responsible for designing all aspects of a character’s clothing including the color, patterns, fabrics, and more.

Dressmaker

A dressmaker makes dresses and other garments from a pattern. Unlike some professions that use the term, dressmakers are generally trained professionals rather than people who learn how to sew at home. Dressmakers take orders for garments of all styles and sizes to provide customers with well-made, stylish clothing.

Fashion Consultant

A fashion consultant provides advice to a fashion brand, on how to improve the design or presentation of their products. Fashion consultants help small businesses, designers, and individuals with marketing & advertising research, generating new ideas, and producing design concepts for both print and digital media.

Fashion Merchandiser

A fashion merchandiser is a person who manages the manufacture and sale of apparel. They are in charge of sourcing, approving, manufacturing, distributing, and pricing their products. Fashion merchandisers typically work for clothing manufacturers or retailers seeking to increase their market share.

Fashion Model

A fashion model is a professional who is employed to model the clothes of different fashion designers in live runway shows, in print ads, or in advertising campaigns. Fashion models generally work for an agency or a modeling company and may be seen at fashion shows, in advertisements, editorial features, and magazine covers.

Jewelry Designer

A jewelry designer is a person who designs pieces of jewelry, often including precious materials like gold, silver, and diamonds. Jewelry designers may work in production of pieces for fashion designers to sell in their showrooms or off the rack, or directly with customers to create custom-made pieces.

Makeup Artist

A makeup artist is someone who is knowledgeable about the application and techniques of makeup. Depending on the type of work that a person is looking for and their skill level, they may have opportunities in the industries of television production, fashion design, theater productions, photography studios, and retail locations.

Needleworker

A needleworker is somebody who makes needlepoint, cross-stitch, or other sewing projects on a needle and thread. A needleworker makes designs by pulling the thread through small pieces of fabric called stitches. They use this technique to make their own personal art as well as beautiful original products for family or friends.

Pattern Maker

A pattern maker is a person who creates templates or patterns for garments, textiles, or other types of products. The pattern maker works with designers, garment manufacturers, or other clients to create accurate patterns that can be used for mass production or customization.

Shoe Designer

A shoe designer is a professional who designs footwear. Shoe designers are often employed by footwear manufacturers to create shoes for retail markets. Shoe Designers may also work independently as consultants or work in conjunction with fashion designers.

Tailor

A tailor is a person whose job is to make, alter, repair, or otherwise improve clothing. In modern times the term can also refer to a shop that does this work. A tailor can be referred to as someone who makes clothes with needle and thread. Other names for a tailor include shirtmaker and clothier.

Textile Designer

A textile designer is one who creates textiles using yarn, cloth, thread, or other materials. The profession exists worldwide, and designers work with many materials and in a variety of styles. Textiles are designed for producing many different types of garments, including apparel, interiors (such as wall coverings), furnishings, etc.

Film industry professionals include actors, directors, producers, camera operators, editors, animators, and even video game designers. There are many types of careers in the film industry, each requiring varying degrees of education and training. And while most people know that it takes actors and directors to make the world of film, there are many occupations behind the scenes that help make the industry run.

A career in photography can lead to a diversity of career paths. Learning how to take the best photos and ways to improve them is only one part of the job. Between getting to the right place at the right time, organizing your equipment, and promoting yourself as a photographer, there’s quite a lot that goes into becoming successful in this field.

Advertising Photographer

Advertising photography is the use of still or moving images in a marketing campaign for products or services. It is a smart and effective way to generate interest in what you are selling or to influence consumers buying decisions. The most common forms of advertising photography include social media, TV, and print ads.

Aerial Photography

An aerial photographer uses a high-powered camera to capture images via remote-controlled unmanned aircraft. Aerial photography is a great way to get an aerial view of a location, such as an event (like a wedding or concert) or a natural disaster. Aerial photography is frequently used in areas that are hard to reach on foot.

Celebrity Photographer

A celebrity photographer is a professional who takes pictures of famous people. Their clients may be actors, musicians, models, athletes, or other public figures. Celebrity photographers usually work in one of two ways: for an agency that supplies photographs to magazines and newspapers; or on their own as independent contractors who sell images directly to advertisers, writers, or media outlets.

Commercial Photographer

Commercial photography is a genre that focuses on creating high-quality images for the purpose of promoting and selling products or services.

Fashion Photographer

A fashion photographer is a skilled visual artist who specializes in capturing clothing, accessories, and models, blending creativity with technical expertise to showcase fashion and style in photographs.

Food Photographer

A food photographer is a professional who skillfully captures appetizing and visually appealing images of various cuisines, dishes, and culinary creations, enticing viewers with the artistry of food.

Macro Photographer

Macro photographers use a high-magnification lens to take photographs of tiny objects, like flowers and insects. This type of photography is called ‘macro’ because it allows the photographer to reveal details about the subject that are otherwise obscured by the (small) size of the object.

Nature Photographer

Nature photographers specialize in capturing nature in ways that reveal the beauty and true detail of the world around us. They work outdoors and use a variety of techniques to capture their subjects, including long-exposure and HDR photography, macro photography, and even action photography.

Photo Retoucher

A photo retoucher is a professional that employs photo-manipulation skills to modify and enhance photos. They are able to fix existing photos by removing blemishes or wrinkles, or creating the illusion of features. Their skills that are sought after in industries such as fashion design, filmmaking, marketing, and advertising.

Photographer

A photographer is someone who captures an image onto a permanent medium like film, paper, or canvas. Photographers have many different jobs including taking photos of natural scenes, events, and people. Their photos are used in advertising, art, and education, as well as printed publications, web, and social media.

Photojournalist

A photojournalist is someone who takes photographs to document current events, either for a newspaper or a publication. Photojournalists help to tell a story of what’s happening in the world by showing what people are experiencing. They become part of the news team and work alongside reporters.

Portrait Photographer

A portrait photographer creates images that capture a person’s likeness, personality, and their emotions. They work with people in various career fields from individuals who are looking to update their photos for social media or business marketing collateral to photojournalists documenting the lives of people in their cultures.

Underwater Photographer

An underwater photographer is a person who takes pictures of aquatic life. They are also known as a sea scape photographer or marine explorer. They use photographic techniques such as super wide lens, strobe lights, and artificial lighting to take stunning pictures of aquatic life and coral reefs.

Wedding Photographer

A wedding photographer is a type of photographer who photographs weddings. They may work for a business or freelance, and do not necessarily need to have formal training. A wedding photographer’s job is to make sure the bride and groom have a photographic record of their big day, so they can remember it perfectly years later.

Wildlife Photographer

A wildlife photographer is someone who captures images of wildlife in their natural habitats. The primary focus of their work involves documenting a species for the purpose of scientific research, public awareness campaigns such as conservation issues, and commercial stock photography.
